newsitem.title: USA: Greenspan opposes U.S. balanced budget amendment.
newsitem.headline: Greenspan opposes U.S. balanced budget amendment.

text.p: U.S. Federal Reserve Board Chairman Alan Greenspan on Thursday said that he was uncomfortable with a balanced budget amendment to the Constitution.
In testimony before the Senate Finance Committee, Greenspan reiterated his opposition to such a plan but said that if an amendment was undertaken it should be self-enforcing.

"If we're going in that direction, then I think we ought to create something which is self-enforcing, such as requiring super-majorities (in Congress) to pass all authorization, expenditure and outlay bills," he said.
